Introduction
[RTC_Timer_RTC001 App]

Introduction

Real-time clock (RTC) is a clock that keeps track of the current time. The RTC is capable of running from an alternate source of power, so it can continue to keep time while the primary source of power is off or unavailable. The timer remains operational when the core domain is in power-down. The kernel part of the RTC keeps running as long as the hibernate domain is powered with an alternate supply source.

RTC001 App provides APIs to Enable/Disable the RTC module and also provides timer & alarm interfaces for other Apps. The Alarm and Time Tick Interrupts can be enabled from the App UI.

Scope

App provides timer as well as alarm interfaces for top level Apps. The alarm event acts as a wake up source from hibernate domain.

Abbreviation

  1. API: Application Program Interface
  2. App: DAVE3 Application
  3. GUI: Graphical User Interface
  4. SW: Software
  5. RTC: Real Time Clock

Reference

Device Reference Manual.

Limitation
